text: The 2016 African Nations Championship Final was a football match to determine the winners of the CHAN 2016 tournament and took place on 7 February 2016. The match contested by DR Congo and Mali at the Amahoro Stadium in Kigali. DR Congo won the match 3–0, winning the title for the second time. DR Congo became the first nation to win the trophy twice, having won the inaugural CHAN tournament.CHAN 2016: DR Congo are champions after victory over Mali BBC SportsDemocratic Republic of Congo claim 2016 African Nations Championship rfi.fr DR Congo win second CHAN title with 3-0 win over Mali France 24 ==Background== DR Congo appeared in their 3rd tournament, and their 2nd final. There previous best performance in the tournament was reaching the finals in 2009 and won that tournament. Mail was also making its 3rd appears in the tournament and their best performance in the tournament was in 2014 reaching the quarter-finals. DR Congo beat the host nation Rwanda 1–2 (a.e.t.) in the quarter-finalsCHAN 2016: DR Congo beat Rwanda 2-1 in extra-time BBC Sports and beat Guinea 5–4 on Penalties after a 1–1 in regulation time in the semi- finals.CHAN 2016: DR Congo into final beating Guinea on penalties BBC Sports Mail beat Tunisia 2–1 in the quarter-finalsCHAN 2016: Mali fight back to beat Tunisia BBC Sports and beat Ivory Coast 1–0 in the Semi-finals.Mali Clinch CHAN Final Berth www.soccerladuma.co.za ==Route to the final== {| style="width:100%; text-align:center" |- style="vertical-align:top; background:#99CCFF" ! colspan="2" width=44%| DR Congo ! width=12%|Round ! colspan="2" width=44%| Mali |- style="vertical-align:top; background:#C1E0FF" | Opponents | Result | Group stage | Opponents | Result |- |align="left"| |3–0 |style="background:#C1E0FF" | Match 1 |align="left"| |2–2 |- |align="left"| | 4–2 | style="background:#C1E0FF" | Match 2 |align="left"| |1–0 |- |align="left"| |1–3 | style="background:#C1E0FF" | Match 3 |align="left"| |0–0 |- | colspan="2" style="text-align:center"|Group B winner | style="background:#C1E0FF"| Final standings | colspan="2" style="text- align:center"|Group D Runner-up |- style="vertical-align:top; background:#C1E0FF" | Opponents | Result | Knockout stage | Opponents | Result |- |align="left"| |1–2 (a.e.t.) | style="background:#C1E0FF" | Quarter-finals |align="left"| |2–1 |- |align="left"| |1–1 (aet) (5–4 Pen) | style="background:#C1E0FF" | Semi-finals |align="left" | |1–0 |} ==Match== ===Summary=== DR Congo enjoyed huge support from the crowd although it was Mali who started with more purpose with Mamadou Coulibaly going close twice with a couple of early shots. But it was an exquisite individual strike from Meschak Elia which broke the deadlock on 29 minutes, to give DR Congo the lead. His long-range, angled shot gave Mali keeper Djigui Diarra no chance, and set Ibenge's side up nicely going into the break. Elia again proved to be too much for Mali in the second half, scoring his second goal on 61 minutes.DR Congo 3-0 Mali: Elia inspires Leopards to African Nations Championship glory goal.com He dribbled past Diarra, placing the ball into an empty net. That goal sparked mass celebrations in the stands amongst the hoards of DR Congo fans. Mali tried to get back into the match, but failed to make the most of their opportunities. Lassana Samaka missed a good chance for Mali ten minutes later, with the game put beyond doubt when Jonathan Bolingi added a third for DR Congo 18 minutes from time. 2016 African Nations Championship, Final report ESPN Meschak Elia was given a standing ovation when he was substituted on 86 minutes, and the crowd sang out coach Florent Ibenge's name. DR Congo’s clean sheet on the night made it the second time they lifted the CHAN trophy without conceding a goal in the final.DR Congo Are Two-Time CHAN Champions, Thrash Mali 3-0 In The Final completesportsnigeria.com ===Details=== ==Notable spectators == Host President Paul Kagame was in attendance. ==See also== * 2016 African Nations Championship ==References== == External links == *Orange African Nations Championship, Rwanda 2016, CAFonline.com 2016 Final Category:Mali national football team matches Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo national football team matches Category:February 2016 sports events in Africa
title: 2016 African Nations Championship Final
